key_risks: Quality control and instructor compensation issues
Intense competition in the EdTech market
Legal and ethical concerns, including deceptive pricing practices
controversies: $4 million settlement over deceptive pricing practices
Allegations of privacy violations and use of tracking tools without explicit consent
social_issues: Variability in course quality due to reliance on user-generated content
governance_issues: Potential legal liabilities from insufficient content review processes
Regulatory scrutiny and reputational risks from legal settlements

sources.title: Udemy Files for U.S. IPO as Remote Learning Shift Drives Revenue Surge
sources.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO — Oct 5, 2021 — Online learning platform Udemy Inc on Tuesday filed regulatory paperwork for an initial public offering (IPO) in the United States, revealing a surge in revenue last year driven by the pandemic-led accelerated shift toward remote learning. The San Francisco-based company's revenue grew 55.6% to $429.9 million in 2020 from a year earlier, its filing showed.

sources.title: Udemy Faces Lawsuits Over Facebook Data Sharing
sources.snippet: In the digital labyrinth, Udemy, a renowned online learning platform, is under scrutiny for alleged privacy breaches involving Meta, formerly Facebook. Claims suggest that Udemy used Meta's pixel tool to track user activities, possibly sharing sensitive data, including Facebook IDs and user course engagement.
